events.name: Build your own personal web page!
events.description:
Welcome to another Women Who Code Singapore's event this year. Join us to learn the basics of HTML & CSS and build your own personal web page. This workshop is for all women with little or no programming experience. Bring your laptop along as this is going to be a hands on workshop. At the end of this session, you will be able to understand the basics of creating a web page, designing & formatting content and also deploying the page to share with everyone else! Our facilitator for the workshop – Sher Minn Chong (@piratefsh) : Sher Minn is a front-end web engineer by profession at Viki and also a casual generative artist. She was the co-founder of Rails Girls in KL, a volunteer effort to make computer science accessible to all. Some of her favourite things are web tech, teaching programming, and making weird art with code. Schedule: 6.30 - 7.00 PM: Check-in, Networking, #ApplaudHer 7.00 - 7.15 PM: Updates from Women Who Code & Host Introduction 7.15 - 7.45 PM: Hands on workshop part 1 (design your page, basics of html) 7.50 – 8.20 PM: Hands on workshop part 2 (Basics of CSS, Deploying the page) 8.20 - 8.30 PM: Final remarks & networking 


Some pre-requisites for the workshop (drop us a line if you have any questions): -  Please install sublime text. This will be used as an editor for the workshop (https://www.sublimetext.com/3) -  Please create a github account (https://github.com/join) - we will use this to deploy the webpage via GitHub pages! -  If you don’t have a github account (and don’t want one!) – Please create a dropbox account and an account on pancake (https://www.pancake.io )  This event is intended for women only. All attendees kindly read and abide by the Women Who Code Code of Conduct. Our event host:
events.location: Palo IT Innovation Studio, 56 Boat Quay, Singapore

events.name: Practical Data Manipulation in R
events.description: Dr. Pieter Fourie from the Future Cities Lab will cover the power of the dplyr library in R
events.location: Future Cities Laboratory - VALUE LAB, 1 CREATE WAY #06-01, Singapore

events.name: TensorFlow and Deep Learning: 3rd Event Generative Deep Learning
events.description: Having seen the level of interest in Sam's talk about Generative Adversarial Networks in February, we've got two talks that explore how Networks can be used to *create* content. As an introduction to the ideas, Martin will explain how 'Style Transfer' works.   Taking it further, Sam will show his recent work on Super-Resolution (making CSI's "enhance" a reality). We've also got two confirmed "Lightning Talks" : One of which focuses on the architecture of the recently TPU devices from Google. As always, we're actively look for more speakers - both '30 minutes long-form', and lightning talks where we welcome folks to come up and talk about something cool they've done with TensorFlow and/or Deep Learning for 5-10mins (if you have slides, then #max=10). The key for the Lightning Talks slot is simply the cool/interesting factor. It doesn't matter whether you're an expert or and enthusiastic beginner: Given the responses we have had, we're sure there are lots of people who would be interested to hear what you've been playing with. Please suggest yourself here : https://www.meetup.com/TensorFlow-and-Deep-Learning-Singapore/suggestion/ (https://www.meetup.com/TensorFlow-and-Deep-Learning-Singapore/suggestion/)
events.location: Google Asia Pacific, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Mapletree Business City, , Singapore

events.name: April Meetup
events.description:
Hi friends!   We're thrilled to have another Elixir meetup in April.  Programme  7.00pm: Doors open - mingle over food and drinks 7.20pm: Start of session, opening address by hosts 7.30pm: Start of scheduled talks 9:00pm: Community announcements / End of event  Scheduled Talks • "Package and release your Elixir/Phoenix app with distillery, docker/docker-compose" by Yeong Sheng • Slot available! 


Information for Attendees **Please bring a photo ID to get through building security!** The meetup will be held at Thoughtworks Singapore, 18 Cross Street #11-08. If you're traveling by MRT, the closest MRT station is DT18 Telok Ayer.  Sponsors Food and venue: Thoughtworks
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore
